intro: Capsella elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf weed or slender chickweed, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, elliptic in shape, and have a slightly serrated margin. Capsella elliptica is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural settings.
